description: A fast-paced introduction to the fundamental concepts of programming and software design. This course assumes some previous programming experience, at the level of a high school computer science class or CIS110. (If you got at least 4 in the AP Computer Science A or AB exam, you will do great.) No specific programming language background is assumed: basic experience with any language (for instance Java, C, C++, VB, Python, Perl, or Scheme) is fine. If you have never programmed before, you should take CIS 110 first.
name: PROG LANG & TECH I

values.comments:
This course teaches the fundamentals of programming in a manner that is applied to the most important areas of computer science. Java is the language of choice although some experimentation is done in Python. No textbook is required but the Java Backpack Reference Guide is highly recommended and allowed during exams.

Students found the course fast-paced and reported learning a lot.

Most students liked Professor Marcus\'s lectures and enthusiasm, calling him “totally fun”.

Students found that homework assignments were excessive in length and did not really correspond to the material taught. The target audience is for students with some programming experience, especially in Java as it helps deal with minor tricks that aren\'t taught.
